passage:
(1) The 21st century has witnessed an unprecedented growth in online businesses across the globe. What began as simple e-commerce websites has evolved into complex digital ecosystems that connect millions of consumers with products and services. The rapid advancement of internet technologies has enabled entrepreneurs to establish profitable businesses with minimal physical infrastructure, thereby reducing startup costs and expanding market reach.

(2) Online business models have diversified significantly over the past two decades. While traditional retail remains a substantial component of e-commerce, subscription-based services, digital content creation, and platform-based businesses have emerged as powerful alternatives. Companies like Netflix, Spotify, and YouTube have revolutionized entertainment distribution, whereas platforms such as Airbnb and Uber have transformed the hospitality and transportation industries respectively.

(3) The success of online businesses can be attributed to several factors. First, the increasing global internet penetration has expanded the potential customer base exponentially. Second, improvements in payment security and logistics have made online transactions more convenient and trustworthy. Third, sophisticated data analytics enable businesses to understand customer preferences and tailor their offerings accordingly, creating a more personalized shopping experience than possible in physical stores.

(4) Despite the numerous advantages, online businesses face unique challenges. Competition is intense, with low barriers to entry allowing new competitors to emerge constantly. Cybersecurity threats pose significant risks to both companies and customers. Additionally, changing regulations regarding data privacy and consumer protection require ongoing adaptation and compliance measures, adding complexity to business operations.

(5) Looking ahead, the growth of online businesses shows no signs of slowing down. Emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, virtual reality, and blockchain are creating new opportunities for innovation. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated the digital transformation of many industries, with consumers developing new online shopping habits that are likely to persist. As digital and physical retail experiences continue to blend, the most successful businesses will be those that can effectively integrate both channels to meet evolving customer expectations.

questions.question: Which tense is used in the sentence: 'The 21st century has witnessed an unprecedented growth in online businesses'?
Choose the correct form of the verb: 'If online businesses _____ more attention to customer service, they would be more successful.'
Select the correct preposition: 'Many people prefer shopping _____ their mobile phones.'
Identify the passive voice sentence:

options.B: Customers buy products online every day.
options.C: Online payments are processed by secure systems.
options.D: The business grew rapidly last year.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct comparative form?

options.A: Online shopping is more easier than traditional shopping.
options.B: Online shopping is easier than traditional shopping.
options.C: Online shopping is easyer than traditional shopping.
options.D: Online shopping is the more easy than traditional shopping.

questions.question: Choose the correct modal verb: 'You _____ create a user account before making a purchase on this website.'
Select the correct relative pronoun: 'The website _____ crashed yesterday is working again now.'
Identify the correct article usage: 'She started _____ online business selling handmade crafts.'
Choose the correct verb form: 'Many businesses _____ their services online since the pandemic began.'
Identify the correct conditional sentence:

options.A: If the website will crash, we will lose all our data.
options.B: If the website crashes, we will lose all our data.
options.C: If the website would crash, we will lose all our data.
options.D: If the website is crashing, we will lose all our data.

questions.question: Select the correct question form: '_____ you ever bought anything from an international online store?'
Choose the correct verb agreement: 'Neither the customer nor the online representatives _____ able to resolve the issue.'
Identify the sentence with the correct word order:

options.A: Last year launched they an online platform for selling handmade products.
options.B: They last year launched an online platform for selling handmade products.
options.C: They launched last year an online platform for selling handmade products.
options.D: They launched an online platform for selling handmade products last year.

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb: 'The company decided to _____ a new product line for home office equipment.'
Select the sentence with the correct use of infinitive:

options.A: The business plans expanding to international markets.
options.B: The business plans to expand to international markets.
options.C: The business plans expand to international markets.
options.D: The business plans for expanding to international markets.

questions.question: Choose the correct expression to complete: 'Our website traffic has increased _____ since we started our social media campaign.'
Select the appropriate idiom: 'The new e-commerce business is really _____; everyone is talking about it.'
Choose the correct collocation: 'Before launching our online store, we need to _____ market research.'
Select the best conjunction to complete the sentence: 'We offer free shipping on orders over $50, _____ customers often buy additional items to reach this threshold.'
Choose the appropriate expression: 'The company needs to _____ to keep up with changing customer preferences.'
Select the correct phrasal verb: 'We need to _____ new marketing strategies to increase our online presence.'
Choose the correct expression to complete: 'The website redesign was a huge success; it really _____ the number of visitors.'
Select the appropriate connecting phrase: 'The company offers excellent products; _____, their customer service needs improvement.'
Choose the correct expression: 'The founder had to _____ many obstacles before the online business became successful.'
Select the most appropriate response to 'How satisfied are you with your online purchase?'

options.C: I'm very pleased with the quality and quick delivery.

Which of the following is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2 as an alternative to traditional retail?

What is the main purpose of this passage?

options.A: To persuade readers to start online businesses

options.D: To predict the complete disappearance of physical stores

questions.question: In paragraph 2, the word 'whereas' is used to:
Based on the passage, which statement is TRUE about online businesses?

options.A: They have completely replaced physical retail stores
options.C: They benefit from increasing global internet penetration
options.D: They are primarily limited to retail sales

options.A: It is difficult to start an online business
options.B: It is easy for new competitors to enter the market

questions.question: According to the passage, what will characterize successful businesses in the future?

options.D: Effectively integrating digital and physical channels
